---
title: "17: No Such Thing as Too Much"
---

::: {.cell hash='2015-17_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_af739629baddb2b8bda72e677a4ca1a7'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(mistlecode)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
To install `mistlecode` yourself, run `devtools::install_github('guslipkin/mistlecode')`.

 Also loading:  cipheR data.table dplyr purrr slider stringr tidyverse glue
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
dt <- 
  readLines("input.txt") |>
  as.integer() |>
  sort(decreasing = TRUE)

buckets <-
  dt |>
  seq_along() |>
  map_int(\(x) {
    x <-
      dt |>
      combn(x) |>
      data.frame() |>
      map_int(sum)
    x <- sum(x == 150)
    if (x == 0) NA else x
  })
```
:::


`buckets` was made for part 1, but is used in part 2 as well.

## Part 1

This was surprisingly easy. I thought for sure I was going to have to run stuff in parallel.


::: {.cell hash='2015-17_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_c790ebf1c0c52e493212b315d7ba3c01'}

```{.r .cell-code}
sum(buckets, na.rm = TRUE)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 4372
```
:::
:::


## Part 2

Also weirdly easy. Especially since I set myself up for that with part 1.


::: {.cell hash='2015-17_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_962ddbc51d646e9293038e46e116ef29'}

```{.r .cell-code}
buckets |>
  na.omit() |>
  head(1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 4
```
:::
:::
